This is gonna sound weird but I'm always uncomfortable when someone else makes plans for the first meet up. I like to ask the other person out, when I get asked out I have a couple moments of panic deciding if I like the guy and how far I'd be willing to go. So while I'm panicking I'm a bit wishy washy about the plans. After I've thought about it some more I almost always say yes.
I suggest you go on a date with the tinder guy and make plans for some other day with the other guy.

I have a bad habit of talking back to people who are homophobic around me. For context I'm 6'4" and a pretty decent size. I usually just say smart ass remarks...until, I was dating a guy who is around 5'6" Mexican scrawny, pretty much a twink. We were walking through town when a guy around my size in a camo hoodie shoulder checks my date and says "fuck homos". I turned around and gave him a flat tire and said fuck you. He punches me in the chest. (For this part you should know that I grew up in a trailer park in a shit part of a city, I've been fighting since I was old enough to leave the yard) I stomp on his foot punch him in the face and hit him between the legs. Then my date and I ran. He chased us for a bit but I used to go jogging every night back then and that fucking twink could run lol
No idea why I told this story, was just reminded of it.

Keto is great at loosing weight, one of the best diets out there for sheer simplicity but it's not good at keeping the weight off. When you come off keto you have to slowly add carbs back into your diet at the rate of 5carbs a week. Do this until you stop loosing weight and stay the same on the scale, if your weight starts going up then you need to cut back 5 carbs and that becomes your new normal. (Advice from my doctor friend to my friends starting the keto diet).
My advice: momentary diet changes will not counteract a lifetime of poor nutrition. You need to find a diet that you can stick to for the rest of your life, it shouldn't be too strict and you need to be able to forgive yourself for screwing it up every so often.
All that being said, you had the mental fortitude to loose 80lbs on keto, you are definitely made of stern enough stuff to change your life. Good luck out there, though with determination like yours, I'm not sure you need luck.
